author: @berkayislek16
text: As an advice; instead of giving certain number for test_size = 200, I prefer to use this: from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.33)

author: @Terence818
text: I think `X = preprocessing.scale(X)` causes data leakage because it involved test data. I think we should use `s = StandardScaler().fit(X_train)`, `X1 = s.transform(X_train)`, and `X2 = s.transform(X_test)` instead.

text: Simple way to avoid the negative predicted values is to transform the price to the log of price. This enables the estimation of a linear regression model with no negative predicted values by design.

author: @satir6156
text: Wouldn't it be better to transform the categories into dummies instead of [1, 2, 3, ...]?? Since it is all linear algebra, the model assumes that 2 is twice as big as 1, 3 is three times bigger and so on. If you convert them into dummies, it simply assumes that it is different. You lose the order, but the order is already present on the relation to price.
